x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Many students, particularly in underserved communities or large school systems, face barriers in accessing academic, emotional, and career-related support services. Common challenges include: Lack of awareness about available resources (e.g., tutoring, counseling, scholarships, mental health). Overburdened administrative staff and counselors unable to respond to all student queries. Fragmented systems and manual processes for support requests. Students falling through the cracks due to delayed or missed interventions. These issues contribute to lower student performance, decreased engagement, and higher dropout rates—particularly among vulnerable youth populations.

x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

We propose a ServiceNow-powered Student Support Hub using AI agents and case management:

Student Virtual Agent: AI-powered chatbot for students to ask questions, get guidance, and request help—available 24/7 via mobile or web portal.

Unified Support Request Portal: One-stop platform for students to access tutoring, tech support, financial aid, mental health services, etc.

Smart Routing: AI/ML routes requests to appropriate staff based on urgency, topic, and availability.

Early Warning System: Connects to attendance and academic data to identify at-risk students and auto-trigger intervention workflows.

Parental and Faculty Portal: Enables teachers and guardians to refer students or track case progress.

Analytics Dashboard: For school administrators to track service utilization, response times, and student satisfaction.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

Integration with Student Information Systems (e.g., PowerSchool, Infinite Campus).

Compliance with FERPA and local student data privacy laws.

AI models trained on educational topics for better NLP understanding.

Device/browser compatibility for students in underserved communities.

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

Ensuring accessibility across devices and languages.

Gaining adoption from school staff and students unfamiliar with self-service tools.

Balancing automation with human support where needed (e.g., mental health).

Data integration with legacy or siloed systems.
